meanings.definition: A person or thing that interposes.
meanings.sent1: The interposer stepped in to resolve the argument between the two friends.
meanings.sent2: The teacher acted as an interposer to help the students reach a compromise.
meanings.sent3: The interposer, a friendly dog, brought a toy to distract the bickering siblings.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter served as an interposer, diffusing the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The interposer, a mediator, skillfully facilitated the negotiation process.

meanings.definition: A device used to connect two electronic components.
meanings.sent1: The interposer seamlessly linked the computer and printer for efficient communication.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to insert the interposer correctly to ensure proper functioning of the devices.
meanings.sent3: The tiny interposer danced across the circuit board, forming a vital connection.
meanings.sent4: Like a bridge, the interposer bridged the gap between the two electronic components.
meanings.sent5: The interposer, a small but crucial tool, enhanced the performance of the devices.

meanings.definition: A layer of material placed between two objects to improve their connection.
meanings.sent1: The interposer of rubber prevented the glass plates from scratching each other.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic added an interposer of foam to cushion the fragile items during transport.
meanings.sent3: The colorful interposer of fabric added a touch of style to the plain curtains.
meanings.sent4: The interposer of felt acted as a protective barrier between the delicate surfaces.
meanings.sent5: The interposer, a thin sheet of plastic, enhanced the durability of the product.
